intro: Symplocos fuboensis, commonly known as the Indian wax tree, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to the Indian subcontinent. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes many shrubs and trees adapted to acidic soils. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. Its fruits are small, fleshy berries that are edible and often used in local cuisines. Symplocos fuboensis is also valued for its ornamental qualities and traditional medicinal uses.
